snippet: Some are calling on fertility doctors to rely less on high doses of hormones to avoid serious complications, even if it means lower rates of success.
abstract: Critics are calling on doctors to rely less on high doses of hormones in fertility treatments, to avoid serious complications such as ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome, even if it means lower pregnancy rates; fertility clinics in Europe and Japan have turned to a safer, low-dose form of in vitro fertilization, shift that has been resisted in the United States.
lead_paragraph: Some are calling on fertility doctors to rely less on high doses of hormones to avoid serious complications, even if it means lower rates of success.

headline.seo: High Doses of Hormones Add to IVF Complications
headline.main: High Doses of Hormones Faulted in Fertility Care
headline.print_headline: High Doses of Hormones Faulted in Fertility Care
